result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel Carmelo Arroyo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Joel Carmelo Arroyo.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing. Plea hearing proceeded. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court, defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Case may resolve with a global resolution. Court authorize transfer to Branch 36 and Branch 41 for a possible global resolution.  Case adjourned to Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.

Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Joel Carmelo Arroyo in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  This hearing may be streamed live through DACAST at the Court's discretion: 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
